childElements.semanticDescription: A group of business terms providing information on the place and time of delivery or period.
childElements.usageNote: For Invoices that are not subject to simplified invoicing rules according to the VAT directive 2006/112/EC article 226b and 238, the delivery details group must be present and contain a deliver to party name or a delivery location.

childElements.semanticDescription: A group of Business Terms providing information on invoice parties other than the Buyer and Seller
childElements.justification: To create Business Terms that can be used for trading parties that are not specified in the Core Data Model  but are used in UBL Invoice, UN/CEFACT Cross Industry Invoice (CII), and EDIFACT. This will ensure that the model is widely compatible with current e-invoicing systems, which is crucial for seamless integration in various business processes

childElements.semanticDescription: A code that specifies the invoice party role.
childElements.usageNoteExtension: Role code is set to the code for deliver-to party
childElements.justification: For many systems, the Trading Party Identifier is a key piece of information. Multiple Trading Party Identifiers may be assigned or specified. They may be differentiated by using various Identification Schemes.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the Trading Party.

schemeIdentifier.schemeDescription: The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Trading Party Identifier.
schemeIdentifier.schemeUsageNote: The Identification Scheme Identifier shall be chosen from the entries of the list published by the ISO/IEC 6523 maintenance agency, complemented with entries for “Buyer assigned” and “Seller assigned”.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the Location of the Trading Party.
childElements.usageNoteExtension: An Identifier for the location of the Trading Party.

schemeIdentifier.schemeDescription: The Identification Scheme Identifier of the Location of the Trading Party Identifier.

childElements.semanticDescription: A name by which the Trading Party is known.
childElements.justification: To specify the Additional Trading Party type such as Invoicee, Invoice Issuer, Consignee, Consignor, Deliver to Party, Despatch from Party, Exporter, Importer etc.

childElements.semanticDescription: An identifier for the Location assigned by the Seller.
An Identifier issued by an official registrar that identifies the Trading Party as a legal entity or person.

schemeIdentifier.schemeDescription: TThe Identification Scheme Identifier of the Trading Party legal registration Identifier

childElements.semanticDescription: The Trading Party VAT Identifier (also known as Trading Party VAT identification number)
childElements.usageNoteExtension: VAT number prefixed by a country code.

childElements.semanticDescription: A name by which the Trading Party is known.
A unique Identifier for the individual payment terms and payment instructions within the Invoice for the Trading Party
A geocordinate that identifies the Trading Party location
childElements.usageNoteExtension: Should be based on ISO 6709 - Latitude is a number preceded by a sign character. A plus sign (+) denotes norther hemisphere or the equator, and a minus sign (-) denotes southern hemisphere - Longitude is a number preceded by a sign character. A plus sign (+) denotes east longitude or the prime meridian, and a minus sign (-) denotes west longitude or 180Â° meridian *(opposite of the prime meridian)  Example - +52.5200+013.4050 (representing Latitude: +52.5200, Longitude: +13.4050 for Berlin)
